South Africa amends arms export document after inspection row ...  UAE are more comfortable with the new wording, which should unlock the stalled weapons exports. That is a boost to state defence firm Denel, which said last week that the COVID-19 pandemic and the government's subsequent lockdown of the economy had brought its operations to a standstill. Denel also has a local joint venture with Germany's Rheinmetall, Rheinmetall Denel Munition, that stands to benefit from the new wording. In the meantime, however, South Africa's defence sector has been upended by production and export disruptions caused by the pandemic. South Africa, whose arms industry traces its roots to the apartheid era, manufactures defence products from ammunition to missiles and armoured vehicles for its own military and countries around ...
